sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"造反，叛乱，骚乱"之意。
means: rebellion ： 通常指有组织、公开地大规模武断叛乱，着以失败而告终。
revolt ： 指规模相对较小的，持续时间较短，侧重对压迫或不能容忍的情况的反抗。
riot ： 多指没有组织的一群人突然掀起的闹事。也可指暴乱或暴动。

sentence.Network_en: A little adolescent rebellion is commonly believed to be healthy.
sentence.Network_cn: 大家一致认为，青少年有点叛逆是正常的。

sentence.Network_en: The rebellion is expected to further damage the country's image.
sentence.Network_cn: 预计叛乱将会进一步破坏这个国家的形象。

sentence.Network_en: He was prepared to suppress rebellion by shooting down protesters.
sentence.Network_cn: 他准备开枪射击抗议者以镇压叛乱。

...的背景可以追溯至美国革命，以及1794年抗缴酒税的威士忌酒反抗（Whiskey Rebellion），和其他在美国独立后类似的地区性反抗 …
...史陶诺动乱（Stono rebellion）是一场发生在美国南卡罗来纳州的奴隶叛乱。1739年9月的一个星期天，当农场主和白人管家们都前往教堂礼拜。一群奴隶聚集起来攻击了附近城镇的商店，他们烧毁了大半个农.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, from Latin rebellio(n-), from rebellis (see rebel)

entry.def: A rebellion is a violent organized action by a large group of people who are trying to change their country's political system.

example.ex: The British soon put down the rebellion.
example.tran: 英国人很快平息了叛乱。

example.ex: ...the ruthless and brutal suppression of rebellion.
example.tran: 对谋反无情、残酷的镇压

entry.tran: 内讧；（来自政党内部的）反抗
entry.def: A situation in which politicians show their opposition to their own party's policies can be referred to as a rebellion .

example.ex: There was a Labour rebellion when some left-wing MPs voted against the Chancellor's tax cuts...
example.tran: 工党内部发生内讧，一些左翼国会议员对财政大臣提出的减税政策投了反对票。

means.word_mean: 1. refusal to accept some authority or code or convention;

sentences.sentence: "each generation must have its own rebellion"
"his body was in rebellion against fatigue"

means.word_mean: 2. organized opposition to authority; a conflict in which one faction tries to wrest control from another

auth_sentence.content: Within a couple of weeks the rebellion was over.
auth_sentence.res_content: Within a couple of weeks the rebellion was over.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Within a couple of weeks the rebellion was over.

auth_sentence.content: This is the second rebellion Yau Yau has led.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is the second rebellion Yau Yau has led.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is the second rebellion Yau Yau has led.

auth_sentence.content: We don't want another rebellion, she said.
auth_sentence.res_content: We don't want another rebellion, she said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We don't want another rebellion, she said.

stems_affixes.word_buile: belli=bell战争,打斗+ger带来+ent……的→带来战争→交战的
bell战争,打斗+ic+ism具备某种性质→战争的状态→好战性
bellicose[adj.好战的,好斗的]+ity性质→n.好战, 好打架
re反+bell打+ion动作或状态→反打→反叛

stems_affixes.value_cn: 吼叫,怒吼;大声发出,大声喝道

means.word_mean: 对政府的(尤指武装)反抗; 造反; （对权威的）反抗, 不服从

sentences.en: The next year they rose up in rebellion.
sentences.cn: 第二年他们就揭竿起义了。

means.word_mean: 背叛行为, 谋反, 叛乱, 反叛

jushi.chinese: 第二年他们就揭竿起义了。

jushi.english: The new government quickly suppressed the rebellion.
jushi.chinese: 新政府迅速把叛乱镇压下去。
